name: Team Retrospective board
description:
Retrospective made fun!

We run monthly and quarterly basis retrospective on each team. Over the past 2 years we ran dozens of offline/online retros.

The whole exercise is compiled into a 30min. workshop during which every team player gets to share feedback with the rest of the team.


Step 1: Generate feedback! (5-7min)

Give everyone 5 to 7 minutes to write as many feedback as possible (outside the whiteboard).

  • Use green post-its to describe what went well
  • Use red post-its to describe what could have been better

Step 2: Share insights, one by one (15min)

  1. Once done, ask someone to start dragging a feedback on the whiteboard, shortly explaining what this is about.
  2. Then let anyone add-up any card that relates to the first one. It can go on as long as there are related cards, people shortly explaining their share every time.
  3. When there arenâ€™t any more related cards, ask another person to add-up another card and repeat the same process for as long as there are cards left.

Step 3: Group insights by topic or category (5min)

When all the cards are on the white board, it is time to group them by giving them some category names. It is ok to move things during this step!

-> Once all the groups are defined, you can rate them (green card is a +1, red card is a -1).


Step 4: Vote! 3-5min

Once done, give each participant the right to vote for 3 to 5 categories based on what they think is most important.

You can use the related Jam Stamp.


The first time running this workshop will certainly go over 30min. but with time and practice you and your team will have no trouble running these within an 1/2 hour.
